description:
I'm a big fan of Olive version 1, but since the new updates, it's essentially a tech demo of an unusable app.

Pitivi has that nice moveable timeline feature. It's pretty easy to move shot compositions around, and one could either edit "Premiere/Tetris chaotic style" or the old fashioned "cut and splice" method.  It kind of feels like the Linux equivalent to Lightworks, and that's mostly not a bad thing.
summary: Pitivi is what Olive wants to be

Looks nice, but not really working.

Useless app. Uninstalling.
summary: Looks nice, but not really working

description: Unusable, unremoveable, after six hours of being stuck on 60% had to reboot to close program. Can't remove as it say program has unmet dependencies? Claims to need no additional downloads. Don't bother.
Sorry, if you are a Prefessional do not bother...stick to kdenllive, lightworks or davinci

description: While it's not very powerful and doesn't have as many features as some others, it's *very* easy to use and for quick edits it's the perfect editor for me
The only editor which allows you to right-click on the timeline to easily move the playhead at that position, and to scrub the timeline.
Awesome simple to use app. Still crashes a lot, so hope that bugfixes continue.
Very easy for the little ones to get into with it's intuitive interface and easy-to-use cutting features.
summary: My 3 year old created a feature-length documentary

description: I have tried a lot of famous & newbie softwares and found that PITIVI suits me. Although It is very powerful that can perform almost every task yet is very simple that even new users can get task done without any tutoral.
Even on my low end laptop, it lets me open a 5GB+ mp4 file and manipulate it like it's 5MB. No crash, good render.
not to be recommended with Fedora30
crashes a lot, and doesn't really have the few, simple features I want
Was great until 18.04 then it stopped being able to render
I love this app beacause is vere east to use.

I've been editing a video, and it started off somewhat smoothly. I noticed a glitch where when you cut a clip, theres a chance the last couple frames of that clip get corrupted, and I need to recut the clip in different ways to alieviate this problem. 

As well as that issue, when I eventually compiled enough clips to get the video to around 8 minutes, the program began to crash unexpectadly, a lot. There are some good features, byt this program needs a lot of bug fixes in general.
This programm is easy and simple in learning. The programm supports multi-threaded encoding.
yeah its a great app bue when I put it to render all the time I give me and error I don't know if it was for my pc or what but thats the only problem I have

description: The player stops after a few seconds. When I press the ">" control, it returns to the start of the clip.

Linux Open Source community have to unite more, this is complete nonsense, even a mobile phone vider editor is easier and more powerful than this,the only Linux good video editor I worked with is Kdenlive, way more powerfull than this,this is a bad toy, unfortunatelly there's plenty of abandon half baked software on Linux and this is just an example!
I loved the app a
Pitivi is a big treasure in the linux world. I am really happy to use this kind of amazing software for free. Thanks for your hard work, Pitivi developers!
I love it! If you want to get things done without learning a super professional tool, go for this one.
it's ok, needs improvement

While it may not be nearly as expansive as something like kden live, if you are just doing some simple to medium editing tasks, and like the GNOME HIG, this is the way to go. It even handles multithreading surprisingly well which is very impressive for a GNOME/Gstreamer app. If you are on fedora, make sure to get the flatpak because the .rpm seems to be several versions behind.
don't recommend

Tried out all other video creation apps and even tried out web based solutions, but all had either some limitation or they were impossible to understand with poor documentation. 

With Pitivi, I was able to just get started without any help and created this simple video https://youtu.be/YfcKi8uSxI8 for FinHawk.

Would be even more useful if they could add a few more transition effects like roll and slide.
This software is simple and easy to use. Also it is very stable.
It's too hard to use and I'm fed up with always messing up my impossible to make projects which don't even come out right.

Great and intuitive video editor. Still some bugs and kinks to work out, but if you remember to save your progress and have enough RAM available you'll be fine.
Very easy and powerfull for its size (only 3MB download compared with >100MB for less efective video editors).
I like this app. Would rate it for 5 stars if not for a major bug which is present currently. Hope this bug will be resolved.
summary: I like this app for pro features for free

This video editor is absolutely amazing! It is easy to use, it has many professional features and it is fast. After testing 5 other video editing programs, this is my absolute favorite. Thank you to the developers for the effort and time they put into it!
summary: One of the Best Free Video Editors Available!

Using Fedora 33, the app opens and only lets you import video file. Cutting, moving, editing and exporting doesn't work. Use another one.
The only easy video editor I founded that worked.

Pitivi is a great editor. Right now it is more powerful than Windows Movie Maker but less powerful than VEGAS. The recommended way to install it is through flatpak because some distros don't come with all the codecs. Although on their page they put the necessary dependencies. However, although it has improved a lot, it still lacks some important features. But Pitivi's team is doing a great job and I think they are going in the right direction.

description: Application qui fait ce qu'on lui demande sans prise de tête. Très utile pour découper une vidéo notamment, sans passer par des usines à gaz. Jolie interface !

Très Bonn application et très facile a comprendre

Une application bien pensée
Finalisation moyenne. Traduction française incomplète

Tout dabord l'interface et facile d'utilisation, c'est intuitif et il y a quelque effet pour commencer. Les débutants ne seront pas perdu et pour quelqu'un qui vien de Premier Pro pareil.
Parcontre il y a trop de problèmes pour profité pleinement

- Le rendu n'est fait que sur 1 coeur du processeur donc monotâche ce qui fait que le rendu pour un truc tout simple va mettre des heures (entre 30 et 90H)
- Ensuite sur la time line le il y a une chose qui me dérange le fait que quand on clique en bas s'importe où que le minutage change
- Je trouve a titre personnel qu'il n'y a pas assez de codec vidéo, moi personnelement j'en et 3 tandis que sous Premier j'en et plus de 10.
- Et enfin Ubuntu me dit constament que l'application Pitivi a quitté de façon inattendue alors que je sais encore l'utiliser.

Si vous voulez vous entrainer au montage de basse essayer cette application.

Sinon passer votre chemin.
sélection non intuitive, crash à répétition, en bref inutilisable.

Parfait pour l'assemblage de vidéos et accepte les photos (avec la possibilité de les incruster ou non dans la vidéo en plein écran ou partiel)

Très accessible qd on a repéré les poignées de "fondu" sur la vidéo, le son et l'image
Le rendu en 720 p est déjà de bonne qualité... et propose plus....
Bravo

Reste la terminologie des effets qui n'est pas clair.
Yannick

Sur MINT c'est un coussin d'air... un vrai plaisir fonctionne parfaitement. Sur UBUNTU 20.10 une cata ! Les titres ne tiennent pas ou se mélangent sur les pistes, les commentaires non plus, bref : inutilisable, et c'est bien dommage !..

nul                                                            
uhtrègvv(rrt-rt

Points noirs : consomme trop de ressources donc plant de temps en temps, crash également sans raison.

MAIS : applications complète, fond verts, transitions... et le rendu peut se faire en plusieurs formats JE RECOMMANDE !
son décalé et ignoble
bon job sur bonne machine ;)
summary: fait son job et bien pensé pour les débutants

description:
Impossible de créer un nouveau projet: il ne se passe absolument rien.
De toute évidence, il y a un bogue... dès la première fonctionnalité.

Très simple d'accès, j'ai compris en moins de 5 minutes comment cela fonctionnait et ce que je pouvais faire. Les fonctions étaient suffisante pour mon usage (très simple), et le tout est très fluide.
L'export (comme souvent) ne marche pas pour tous les formats, mais a bien fonctionné en MKV. Pas de problème de son pour moi, comme remonté dans d'autres commentaires.
Il m'a fallu installer manuellement des codecs supplémentaires pour importer des vidéos depuis mon appareil photo (format mp4) et il n'y avait pas beaucoup d'aide, j'ai fini par trouver sur des forums le nom de la lib à installer: gstreamer1.0-libav
summary: Simple à utiliser et très complètes pour des débutants
